from: Alabama ETV
add one -
Gerald Appy, Associate Director, Georgia Center for Continuing
Education, lead the programming discussion group. A panel consisting
of John Young, Manager, WUNC-TV, University of North Carolina; Lee
Franks, Program Director, WUFT, University of Florida; Holt Riddleburger,
Program Director, WEDU-TV, Tampa; Hill Bermont, Program Director, WGTV,
University of Georgia,reviewed the elements of ETV programming,
audience needs, source material and scheduling.
The ETV in-school utilization unit; wasrunder supervision of Dr.
Clyde Blair, Director Secondary Education, Alabama State Department of
Education. Heading the discussion were Mrs. Helen Stephens, Principal,
Bluff Park School, Jefferson County; Mrs. Mabel F. Gunsaluus, Classroom
Teacher, Jones Valley High School, Birmingham; Mrs Mary Rogers, ETV
Instructor, Birmingham Area ETV Association; Dr. Earl Sechriest, Assistant
Superintendent, Birmingham Public Schools; William Bowden, ETV Consultant,
Southern Regional Educational Board, Atlanta, Georgia, Dr. Victor Kerns,
Professor Education, Auburn University.- It was agreed that effective
ETV utilization stems from effective teaching and compatable attitudes
on the part of the TV instructor and the classroom teacher, in addition
to a progressive point of view of the school principal. There was
mutal expression that "new education ideas should be tried using the
electronic medium. The danger of telecourses ’’becoming routine or dull'*
was warned against.
Reviews of types of adult and community programming which have
been telecast by ETV operations was the topic of the group meeting with
Dr. Frazer Banks, Studio Director, Birmingham Area ETV assocation.
